meanings.definition: To remove a carboxyl group from a compound.
meanings.sent1: I decarboxylate the molecule by taking out the carboxyl part.
meanings.sent2: During the process, enzymes decarboxylate the compound to make it more reactive.
meanings.sent3: Why did the scientist decarboxylate the chemical? To solve the mystery!
meanings.sent4: The reaction decarboxylated the compound, transforming it into something new.
meanings.sent5: The lab experiment showed how heat can decarboxylate the substance effectively.

meanings.sent1: The compound will decarboxylate under specific conditions.
meanings.sent2: When heated, the substance will naturally decarboxylate.
meanings.sent3: The chemical seemed surprised to decarboxylate so quickly!
meanings.sent4: As time passed, the compound began to decarboxylate on its own.
meanings.sent5: The reaction in the flask caused the compound to decarboxylate rapidly.
